bestBHT.bht: Jesus reclined and continuously gave thanks as He broke the seven loaves, then gave them to His disciples to set before the multitude. This act of continuous giving displayed His generosity and care for the people. Despite the disciples' forgetfulness, unbelief, and lack of understanding, they obediently followed their Lord's instructions.

Marvin Vincent: To sit down [αναπεσειν] . Lit., to recline.
Brake and gave. See on Mark 6:41.
John Gill: and he took the seven loaves, and gave thanks, and brake them;
and gave to his disciples to set before [them], the multitude,
they were obedient to their Lord's commands, though they were so forgetful, unbelieving, and stupid.

bhtAttempts.bht: Jesus took the seven loaves, gave thanks, and continuously broke them, then gave them to His disciples to set before the multitude. This act of giving was not just a one-time action, but a continuous process, showing His generosity and care for the people. Even though the disciples may have been forgetful, unbelieving, and slow to understand, they were obedient to their Lord's commands.

Jesus reclined and continuously gave thanks as He broke the seven loaves, then He gave them to His disciples to set before the multitude. This act of continuous giving displayed His generosity and care for the people. Despite the disciples' forgetfulness, unbelief, and lack of understanding, they obediently followed their Lord's instructions.

Jesus took the seven loaves, gave thanks, and continuously broke them, then gave them to His disciples to set before the multitude. This act of giving was not just a one-time action, but a continuous process, showing His generosity and care for the people. Even though the disciples may have been forgetful, unbelieving, and slow to understand, they were obedient to their Lord's commands.

Jesus reclined and constantly gave thanks as He broke the seven loaves. He then distributed them to His disciples, instructing them to set the bread before the large crowd. This continuous process of giving demonstrated His abundant generosity and concern for the people. Despite the disciples' shortcomings of forgetfulness, unbelief, and ignorance, they faithfully carried out their Lord's instructions.

Jesus reclined and continuously gave thanks as He broke the seven loaves, then gave them to His disciples to set before the multitude. This act of continuous giving displayed His generosity and care for the people. Despite the disciples' forgetfulness, unbelief, and lack of understanding, they obediently followed their Lord's instructions.
